feedback.Physical Object: Included — A massive discrete structure with clearly defined boundaries.
feedback.Synthetic: Included — Manufactured and assembled through human industrial processes.
feedback.Biological/Biomimetic: Excluded — While some blades may be inspired by biology, biomimicry is not essential to the identity of a wind turbine.
feedback.Powered: Included — Requires electricity to operate yaw motors, blade pitch control, sensors, and control systems.
feedback.Structural: Included — Reinforced tower and nacelle architecture provide load-bearing support.
feedback.Observable: Included — Visually and aurally perceptible from long distances.
feedback.Physical Medium: Included — Composed of tangible materials like steel, carbon fiber, concrete.
feedback.Active: Included — Continuously rotates, tracks wind, and adjusts orientation or pitch.
feedback.Intentionally Designed: Included — Purpose-built to harvest wind energy and convert it into electricity.
feedback.Outputs Effect: Included — Produces electrical output with measurable external consequence.
feedback.Processes Signals/Logic: Included — Onboard systems process sensor data and control blade pitch, yaw, and braking.
feedback.State-Transforming: Included — Adjusts multiple internal and environmental-facing states in real-time.
feedback.Human-Interactive: Excluded — Operates autonomously with minimal direct manipulation.
feedback.System-integrated: Included — Deployed as part of a wind farm or energy grid.
feedback.Functionally Autonomous: Included — Manages its behavior and safety in changing wind conditions.
feedback.System-Essential: Excluded — Replaceable and modular; no single turbine is indispensable.
feedback.Signalling: Excluded — Does not communicate symbolic or informational content to humans.
feedback.Rule-governed: Included — Operates according to well-defined control logic and physical laws.
feedback.Temporal: Included — Function is fundamentally tied to time-based dynamics (wind patterns, cycles).
feedback.Symbolic: Excluded — May be symbolic in context, but not intrinsically.
feedback.Compositional: Excluded — Not abstractly modular in its encoded structure.
feedback.Digital/Virtual: Excluded — Encoded here as a physical energy system.
feedback.Economically Significant: Included — A core component of modern renewable infrastructure and capital investment.
feedback.Politicised: Included — Frequently debated in energy policy, land use, and climate discourse.
feedback.Ethically Significant: Included — Directly tied to climate ethics and environmental sustainability.
feedback.Social Construct: Excluded — Material object with intrinsic function.
feedback.Institutionally Defined: Excluded — Not defined by institutional fiat.
feedback.Identity-Linked: Excluded — Not inherently tied to individual or group identity.
feedback.Regulated: Excluded — Subject to policy constraints, but not intrinsically defined by them.
feedback.Ritualised: Excluded — Not used in ceremonial contexts.

encoding_notes: This encoding treats the wind turbine as an autonomous, powered, system-integrated energy technology. Biomimicry was excluded based on the minimalist standard, as it is not essential to the category. Final UHT code: DFF6220D.
